Arts Internship","assoc_campus":null,"assoc_url":"/undergraduate/courses/2022/HUMS2000","assoc_class":"Course","assoc_award_titles":null,"assoc_state":"inactive","assoc_award_single":"","assoc_code":"HUMS2000","assoc_class_translated_subjects":"Course","assoc_faculty":"Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture","assoc_class_translated":"Program","assoc_duration_hb_display":"","assoc_current_version":{},"links":[]}],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"FADA6700 - ADA Professional Placement","description":"

ADA Work Integrated Learning (WIL) - Professional Placement is an elective providing Arts, Design and Architecture students an opportunity to gain targeted professional work experience, and to explore the dynamics, requirements, and expectations of a workplace. Aligned with the UNSW’s emphasis on work integrated learning (WIL), this course provides opportunities for students to develop practical knowledge, capabilities, and employability skills within a supervised and immersive setting.


Students spend 120 hours with a host organisation on a placement or project. Self-guided reading on organisational theory, plus research on a particular aspect of the internship will enhance student’s understanding of their host organisation.


Placement opportunities can be either self-sourced or advertised by the school, please contact the Faculty WIL Unit for further details: ada-wil@unsw.edu.au

","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"eb35c6a31b567c50d5fb0fabdc4bcb1a","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":"Individual","value":"Individual"},"assessment_name":"Placement Showcase","assessment_type":{"label":"Presentation","value":"presentation"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"30","description":"

This assessment summarises and consolidates student’s learnings and insights gained through the placement experience. Emphasis is placed on the soft and unexpected skills learnt and what students will do with this knowledge moving forward. How has this experience shaped your professional identity now and in the future?

Students are required to prepare a 3 x 3 presentation (3 slides presented in 3 minutes) that showcases their experiences, reflections, and learnings throughout the placement.

Presentations will be visual and verbal at a showcase event with Industry partners and supervisors invited to attend.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"a3350ea31b567c50d5fb0fabdc4bcb43","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"ab350ea31b567c50d5fb0fabdc4bcb42","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"ab350ea31b567c50d5fb0fabdc4bcb46","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":"Individual","value":"Individual"},"assessment_name":"Placement Reflection","assessment_type":{"label":"Assignment","value":"assignment"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"50","description":"

Students have a choice of either an Essay, E-folio or Report covering:

  1. Organisational analysis of the host/ Industry
  2. Personal reflection of the placement experience and their professional development
","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"a3350ea31b567c50d5fb0fabdc4bcb43","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"ab350ea31b567c50d5fb0fabdc4bcb42","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"ab350ea31b567c50d5fb0fabdc4bcb43","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"af350ea31b567c50d5fb0fabdc4bcb41","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"e3350ea31b567c50d5fb0fabdc4bcb4c","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":"Individual","value":"Individual"},"assessment_name":"Placement Goal Setting and Evaluation","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"20","description":"

This assessment simulates a real industry performance review cycle which students will encounter once they enter the workforce.

 

  • Assessment 01a (10%): Student led report articulating goals and tasks agreed with their supervisor to be achieved through a formal meeting

 

  • Assessment 01b (10%): Final evaluation and report completed by the supervisor on the student’s performance during their placement with reference to their
","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"ab350ea31b567c50d5fb0fabdc4bcb42","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"ab350ea31b567c50d5fb0fabdc4bcb43","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"af350ea31b567c50d5fb0fabdc4bcb41","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"ff350ea31b567c50d5fb0fabdc4bcb51","links":[]}]}],"inactive_course_alert":null,"timetableURL":"http://timetable.unsw.edu.au/2022/FADA6700.html","subject_sample_text_staticcontent":"","links":[]}
contentlets.keywords: hums2000,benv6800,professional placement,internship,built environment internships,arts internship,ada wil,wil
contentlets.description:
ADA Work Integrated Learning (WIL) - Professional Placement is an elective providing Arts, Design and Architecture students an opportunity to gain targeted professional work experience, and to explore the dynamics, requirements, and expectations of a workplace. Aligned with the UNSW’s emphasis on work integrated learning (WIL), this course provides opportunities for students to develop practical knowledge, capabilities, and employability skills within a supervised and immersive setting.

Students spend 120 hours with a host organisation on a placement or project. Self-guided reading on organisational theory, plus research on a particular aspect of the internship will enhance student’s understanding of their host organisation.

Placement opportunities can be either self-sourced or advertised by the school, please contact the Faculty WIL Unit for further details: ada-wil@unsw.edu.au
contentlets.title: ADA Professional Placement

Arts Internship","assoc_campus":null,"assoc_url":"/undergraduate/courses/2022/HUMS2000","assoc_class":"Course","assoc_award_titles":null,"assoc_state":"inactive","assoc_award_single":"","assoc_code":"HUMS2000","assoc_class_translated_subjects":"Course","assoc_faculty":"Faculty of Arts, Design and Architecture","assoc_class_translated":"Program","assoc_duration_hb_display":"","assoc_current_version":{},"links":[]}],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"FADA6700 - ADA Professional Placement","description":"

ADA Work Integrated Learning (WIL) - Professional Placement is an elective providing Arts, Design and Architecture students an opportunity to gain targeted professional work experience, and to explore the dynamics, requirements, and expectations of a workplace. Aligned with the UNSW’s emphasis on work integrated learning (WIL), this course provides opportunities for students to develop practical knowledge, capabilities, and employability skills within a supervised and immersive setting.


Students spend 120 hours with a host organisation on a placement or project. Self-guided reading on organisational theory, plus research on a particular aspect of the internship will enhance student’s understanding of their host organisation.


Placement opportunities can be either self-sourced or advertised by the school, please contact the Faculty WIL Unit for further details: ada-wil@unsw.edu.au

","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"eb35c6a31b567c50d5fb0fabdc4bcb1a","name":"Blended in-person / online - Standard (usually weekly or fortnightly)"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":"Individual","value":"Individual"},"assessment_name":"Placement Showcase","assessment_type":{"label":"Presentation","value":"presentation"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"30","description":"

This assessment summarises and consolidates student’s learnings and insights gained through the placement experience. Emphasis is placed on the soft and unexpected skills learnt and what students will do with this knowledge moving forward. How has this experience shaped your professional identity now and in the future?

Students are required to prepare a 3 x 3 presentation (3 slides presented in 3 minutes) that showcases their experiences, reflections, and learnings throughout the placement.

Presentations will be visual and verbal at a showcase event with Industry partners and supervisors invited to attend.

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"a3350ea31b567c50d5fb0fabdc4bcb43","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"ab350ea31b567c50d5fb0fabdc4bcb42","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"ab350ea31b567c50d5fb0fabdc4bcb46","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":"Individual","value":"Individual"},"assessment_name":"Placement Reflection","assessment_type":{"label":"Assignment","value":"assignment"},"assessment_id":"3","weighting":"50","description":"

Students have a choice of either an Essay, E-folio or Report covering:

  1. Organisational analysis of the host/ Industry
  2. Personal reflection of the placement experience and their professional development
","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"a3350ea31b567c50d5fb0fabdc4bcb43","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"ab350ea31b567c50d5fb0fabdc4bcb42","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"ab350ea31b567c50d5fb0fabdc4bcb43","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"af350ea31b567c50d5fb0fabdc4bcb41","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"e3350ea31b567c50d5fb0fabdc4bcb4c","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":"Individual","value":"Individual"},"assessment_name":"Placement Goal Setting and Evaluation","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"20","description":"

This assessment simulates a real industry performance review cycle which students will encounter once they enter the workforce.

 

  • Assessment 01a (10%): Student led report articulating goals and tasks agreed with their supervisor to be achieved through a formal meeting

 

  • Assessment 01b (10%): Final evaluation and report completed by the supervisor on the student’s performance during their placement with reference to their
","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"ab350ea31b567c50d5fb0fabdc4bcb42","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"ab350ea31b567c50d5fb0fabdc4bcb43","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"af350ea31b567c50d5fb0fabdc4bcb41","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"ff350ea31b567c50d5fb0fabdc4bcb51","links":[]}]}],"inactive_course_alert":null,"timetableURL":"http://timetable.unsw.edu.au/2022/FADA6700.html","subject_sample_text_staticcontent":"","links":[]}

contentlets.description:
ADA Work Integrated Learning (WIL) - Professional Placement is an elective providing Arts, Design and Architecture students an opportunity to gain targeted professional work experience, and to explore the dynamics, requirements, and expectations of a workplace. Aligned with the UNSW’s emphasis on work integrated learning (WIL), this course provides opportunities for students to develop practical knowledge, capabilities, and employability skills within a supervised and immersive setting.

Students spend 120 hours with a host organisation on a placement or project. Self-guided reading on organisational theory, plus research on a particular aspect of the internship will enhance student’s understanding of their host organisation.

Placement opportunities can be either self-sourced or advertised by the school, please contact the Faculty WIL Unit for further details: ada-wil@unsw.edu.au
